channel.title: Comments on: What to Use Instead of Google Reader?

item.title: By: Erin Hayes
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description: Another article with ideas about Google Reader alternatives, courtesy of Julia: http://chronicle.com/blogs/profhacker/replacing-google-reader/50103
item.content:encoded: Another article with ideas about Google Reader alternatives, courtesy of Julia: http://chronicle.com/blogs/profhacker/replacing-google-reader/50103

item.title: By: Lucy Friedland
item.dc:creator: Lucy Friedland
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/staff.library.ucsf.edu/2013/03/22/what-to-use-instead-of-google-reader/#comment-118">Lucy Friedland</a>.
I'd be interested in learning about alternative RSS readers for both Macs and PCs -- that is, if they're not all cloud-based these days. Thank you!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lucy Friedland.

I’d be interested in learning about alternative RSS readers for both Macs and PCs — that is, if they’re not all cloud-based these days. Thank you!

item.title: By: Lucy Friedland
item.dc:creator: Lucy Friedland
item.description: Ryan and Leslie, I, for one, would attend a workshop on the relative merits of these RSS readers (schedule permitting) ....
item.content:encoded: Ryan and Leslie, I, for one, would attend a workshop on the relative merits of these RSS readers (schedule permitting) ….

item.title: By: Ryan Brazell
item.dc:creator: Ryan Brazell
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/staff.library.ucsf.edu/2013/03/22/what-to-use-instead-of-google-reader/#comment-116">Leslie Kleinberg</a>.
Sure! That would be fun. Let's set up a meeting and see who's interested.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Leslie Kleinberg.

Sure! That would be fun. Let’s set up a meeting and see who’s interested.

item.title: By: Leslie Kleinberg
item.dc:creator: Leslie Kleinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/staff.library.ucsf.edu/2013/03/22/what-to-use-instead-of-google-reader/#comment-109">Ryan Brazell</a>.
Ryan, would you be willing to give a demo of NewsBlur to a bunch of us as a group?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ryan Brazell.

Ryan, would you be willing to give a demo of NewsBlur to a bunch of us as a group?

item.title: By: Michele Mizejewski
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description: @Sean, I haven't done it yet, but I plan to give Feedly a try and saved this article to use as a guide. You might find it helpful too: http://blog.feedly.com/2013/03/14/tips-for-google-reader-users-migrating-to-feedly/
item.content:encoded: @Sean, I haven’t done it yet, but I plan to give Feedly a try and saved this article to use as a guide. You might find it helpful too: http://blog.feedly.com/2013/03/14/tips-for-google-reader-users-migrating-to-feedly/

item.title: By: Sean Mcclelland
item.dc:creator: Sean Mcclelland
item.description:
Google Reader don't care! (With Honey Badger voice.)
Anyone have experience with Feedly or Pulse? I need to categorize my feeds into folders, which NewsBlur does (it's not free but it is inexpensive).
item.content:encoded:
Google Reader don’t care! (With Honey Badger voice.)

Anyone have experience with Feedly or Pulse? I need to categorize my feeds into folders, which NewsBlur does (it’s not free but it is inexpensive).

item.title: By: Ryan Brazell
item.dc:creator: Ryan Brazell
item.description: I <a>switched to NewsBlur</a> last year when Google removed the social aspects of Reader, and I've been a very happy paying customer ever since. <a href="http://newsblur.com"/ rel="nofollow">NewsBlur</a> is honestly my favorite thing on the internet; I probably spend more time there than anywhere else (except perhaps email). I'm happy to show the interface to anyone who's interested to see what it looks like / what it can do -- feel free to track me down anytime if you're curious!
item.content:encoded: I switched to NewsBlur last year when Google removed the social aspects of Reader, and I’ve been a very happy paying customer ever since. NewsBlur is honestly my favorite thing on the internet; I probably spend more time there than anywhere else (except perhaps email). I’m happy to show the interface to anyone who’s interested to see what it looks like / what it can do — feel free to track me down anytime if you’re curious!

item.title: By: Erin Hayes
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description: I feel slightly betrayed that Google is taking away my precious Reader.
item.content:encoded: I feel slightly betrayed that Google is taking away my precious Reader.
